definition: to/for/for the benefit of/to give/to allow/to do sth (for sb)/(grammatical equivalent of 被)/(grammatical equivalent of 把)/(sentence intensifier)
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail

sentences.english: When the British’s demands were not met, they opened fired on the far weaker Zanzibar.
sentences.chinese: 英国的要求没人理，最后对弱小的桑给巴尔发起攻击。

sentences.english: It is not worth while to go round the world to count the cats in Zanzibar.
sentences.chinese: 数桑给巴尔岛的猫儿有多少只而寰游世界是划不来的。

sentences.english: Islands of Zanzibar are generally flat and low land lying.
sentences.chinese: 桑给巴尔的岛一般是比较平坦低的土地。

sentences.english: Zanzibar became independent, after being a British Protectorate since 1890.
sentences.chinese: 自1890年以来一直是英国保护国的桑给巴尔独立。

sentences.english: Zanzibar has of late become the newly discovered destination for holiday makers and honeymooners.
sentences.chinese: 桑给巴尔岛近来已成为度假和蜜月新的理想目的地。
